text:
herb
Del Longman Dictionary of Contemporary English
[Plants](/es-LA/Plants-topic/), [Food](/es-LA/Food-topic/)herbherb /hɜːb $ ɜːrb, hɜːrb/ ●●○ noun [countable] HBPDFa small plant that is used to [improve](/es-LA/dictionary/improve)the [taste](/es-LA/dictionary/taste)of food, or to make [medicine](/es-LA/dictionary/medicine)→ spice Sprinkle the dish with chopped fresh herbs.Ejemplos desde el Corpusherb• This is an astonishingly [fine](/es-LA/dictionary/fine) [wine](/es-LA/dictionary/wine)with great [concentration](/es-LA/dictionary/concentration)and [wonderful](/es-LA/dictionary/wonderful)flavors of black [cherry](/es-LA/dictionary/cherry), [chocolate](/es-LA/dictionary/chocolate), black [raspberry](/es-LA/dictionary/raspberry)and herbs.• We also like to use large [bunches](/es-LA/dictionary/bunch)of [basil](/es-LA/dictionary/basil)and other [fresh](/es-LA/dictionary/fresh)herbs, which [impart](/es-LA/dictionary/impart)a [unique](/es-LA/dictionary/unique)flavor of their own.• You should see some [impressive](/es-LA/dictionary/impressive)herb robert growing on the back between the [river](/es-LA/dictionary/river)and road.• The Physic [Garden](/es-LA/dictionary/garden)is planted with examples of herbs used in [Medieval](/es-LA/dictionary/medieval)times for [medicinal](/es-LA/dictionary/medicinal) [purposes](/es-LA/dictionary/purpose).• Many people think of herbs primarily as something you; find in a small [tin](/es-LA/dictionary/tin)rather than in the [backyard](/es-LA/dictionary/backyard)garden.• [Oregano](/es-LA/dictionary/oregano)is a [pungent](/es-LA/dictionary/pungent)herb, [overpowering](/es-LA/dictionary/overpower)if used [alone](/es-LA/dictionary/alone).• This area [ranges](/es-LA/dictionary/range)from almost full [sun](/es-LA/dictionary/sun#sun__2), [beyond](/es-LA/dictionary/beyond#beyond__8)the herb [bed](/es-LA/dictionary/bed), to [deep](/es-LA/dictionary/deep) [shade](/es-LA/dictionary/shade)adjoining the house.• The [rushes](/es-LA/dictionary/rush)on the floor were clean and [sprinkled](/es-LA/dictionary/sprinkle)with herbs.Origen herb (1200-1300) Old French erbe, from Latin herba “grass, herb”
